author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> So to be more precise here - we are planning to have very intensive sessions around only gas limit, security concerns, found issues and we also want to measure simply everything we can on dedicated network (perfnet2). 

In parallel we have research around worst-cases which can happen and what is the worst block which can be produced and how long it will take to process such one and will be working together to make sure we bump worst ones above some threshold (which now is very theoretical 2 second of block processing time on EL side but we need still to get the good number here based on testing as it may be up to 4 and still could be fine).

Also another workstream we have together with @CPerezz and Stateless team is to bloat the state heavily (from current around 200GB to at least 500GB) and test all the things here (syncing, block processing, re-execute worst cases here). Also should happen very soon at least in some first form.

We want to cover everything - preliminary checks shows that we are fine in 99% of current cases (but we should work on more) with some very edge scenarios where we need to spend more time and check them in more realistic world not in "lab" (it may be that it will be economically impossible and will just be felt by everyone as a small hiccup rather than complete disaster and that's why we still verify it).
